text: Stating Facts  Rant I ve been depressed since  well probably since I was thirteen years old and I began to get sick  I was dealing with not being able to eat  no matter what it was  it would just make me sick and I would just throw up repeatedly  I missed school  I lost friends As an introvert  I was at a loss for what to do  I had no idea what was wrong  As the middle child in a family that was splitting at the seams  I was the glue holding everything together and I had my first depressive break at the age of   when my grandma gifted me an intricately carved pocket knife for my birthday since I was in Boy Scouts  I laid on my bed for close to two hours  holding the blade above my chest  thinking about what a relief it would be to plunge it into my heart and end everything  The thought of how my family would react stopped me though and I got rid of the knife When I was   the doctors finally figured out what was wrong with me and I was getting better  but the depression wouldn t leave me alone  Working two part time jobs without a day off for two years finally wore down on me and I was reduced to sleeping in my car  crying to sleep  because I was so sick of how my life had turned out  I didn t want to be here anymore  couldn t figure out why I had spared myself just to have it all come full circle  Again I didn t do it Now   I can honestly say I only regret two things in my life  Not ending my life the first time I thought of it  and telling someone that I had these thoughts to begin with  Again  the thoughts are back  and this time I don t know if I can actually shake them or if I even want to  I think that if I were to get a gun  any gun  aim in at my temple  and pull the trigger that everyone  myself included  would be in a better place
summary: At the age of 13, when his grandma gave him a pocket knife for his birthday, he thought about ending his life. The thought of how his family would react stopped him and he got rid of the knife. Two years later, the depression wouldn't leave him alone and he was sleeping in his car crying to sleep. He regrets two things in his life: Not ending his own life the first time and telling someone that he had these thoughts to begin with.
cleaned: age grandma give pocket knife birthday think end life thought family react stop got rid knife year later depression not leave sleep car cry sleep regret thing life not end life time tell thought begin

text: How do you control your thoughts Idk if this is the right community for this kind of question but I need help with something  Im not going to post the long story to save people s time so that they can get to others who need help  although I can if anyone s interested  but I really need help controlling my thoughts  Basically  my roomate and his brother sent their friends after me as stalkers for a few weeks and didnt tell me it was them  This fucked me up for obvious reasons but also because my roomate made himself into everything I had at the university I go to  I didnt have many friends and he basically forced all his friends and activities upon me while using me for all of it  as he was an Alpha male and I m a simple introvert   I got depression and anxiety for a bit  though I seemed to have beat it last semster  However  its come back hard now that I ve returned from summer and all my thoughts are consumed by my roomate and his brother trying to torment me  I know these are my own thoughts and not them but they are driving me crazy and are almost constant which is starting to drive me towards suicide as an option at a quickening rate  I have a therapist who hopefully might help in a little more than a week but I was wondering if anyone in this community had any techniques for controlling their thoughts as I m tired of my thoughts being controlled by these two jackasses especially since I love thinking

text: Thank you  Ruth Bader Ginsburg I m not sure where to post this  but I thought a lot of you would understand and relate to this   As many of you may know  United States Supreme Court justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg  RBG  sadly lost her battle to cancer recently  She was a key voice in the fight for marriage equality and same sex marriage   As a bisexual male  I couldn t be more grateful for what she did for the LGBT community  Because of her  I am going to be able to marry the man I love when I want to  Because of her  I can t be refused a job or acceptance to college because of my sexuality  something that so many people before me experienced   Without her  my life would look much different  Obviously  there is still so much work that needs to be done to make members of the LGBT community truly equal to others  but we wouldn t be nearly as close as we are today without her  so thank you RBG  You have changed my life and made this world a better place
summary: Ruth Bader Ginsburg lost her battle to cancer recently. She was a key voice in the fight for marriage equality and same sex marriage. Bisexual male thanks her for what she did for the LGBT community. He can't be refused a job or acceptance to college because of his sexuality.
cleaned: ruth baker ginsburg lose battle cancer recently key voice fight marriage equality sex marriage bisexual male thank community not refuse job acceptance college sexuality
